Hi Patrick. Looks like a Namban tsuba, made of brass and possibly and 
fini=
shed in Shakudo, though I am not completely sure on the finish. It 
would p=
robably date to sometime in the Edo period. So what does all that 
mean ?

=
Namban refers to a tsuba school that specialised in Chinese styles or forms=
.
Shakudo is a mix of alloys (95% brass and 5 gold) that makes a very 
blac=
k finish.
The Edo period ran from 1615 to 1868 app.

The theme is two drago=
ns, intertwined in arabesques, and at the top 
looks t0o be the sacred jewe=
l of Shinto and bottom, some form of mon ( 
family crest )

I could be way =
off on all of that of course.

hope that helps a bit.

Cheers

Richard Turn=
er
